title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling classes from a subpackage using `ajc` command, a directory named "subpackage" is created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: It is expected that `ajc` should have the same behavior as `javac` and not create a nested directory structure when compiling classes from a subpackage.
SR:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using `ajc` command with the appropriate options.
3. Verify that a nested directory structure is not created and the compiled class is placed directly under the subpackage directory.
